title: Thermodynamic favorability POCl3 at two temps

content.question: Which of the following correctly identifies the thermodynamic favorability for the reaction at the two temperatures? (Assume that <math alttext="delta H naught" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>Δ</mtext> <mi>H</mi> <mtext>°</mtext> </math> and <math alttext="delta S naught" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>S</mi><mtext>°</mtext></math> do not change with temperature.)

choices.label: At <math alttext="398 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>398</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> At <math alttext="798 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>798</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> Unfavorable Favorable

At <math alttext="398 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>398</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> At <math alttext="798 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>798</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> Unfavorable Unfavorable

At <math alttext="398 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>398</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> At <math alttext="798 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>798</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> Favorable Favorable

At <math alttext="398 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>398</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> At <math alttext="798 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>798</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> Favorable Unfavorable

content.answer: At <math alttext="398 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>398</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> At <math alttext="798 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mn>798</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></math> Favorable Favorable

topic.text: 9.3: Gibbs Free Energy and Thermodynamic Favorability

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
